title: Strategic Partner
description:
Job ID: 25434 
 





  
 





 More than just a Nordic bank, we are one of the largest IT employers in Tricity and Warsaw. You will have lots of opportunities to expand your abilities and advance your career. Will you help us lead the way in transforming the future of banking?
 





  
 





 Machine learning, robotics, cloud computing. We’re harnessing the power of technology to reinvent the future of banking. A digital revolution is underway – joining us puts you at the heart of it.
 





  
 





**Are you our new Strategic Partner / Expert Data management specialist?** 






  
 





**About the position** 








 We are seeking an experienced and highly skilled
 **Expert Data Management Specialist/Strategic Partner** 
 within our Data Risk Reduction Programme, to join our technology organization. The ideal candidate will be responsible for driving the implementation of BCBS239 principles, overseeing the transition to data products, and leading the adoption of data mesh architecture from a technology delivery perspective. This role is pivotal in ensuring that our data management practices meet regulatory requirements, support business objectives, and promote innovation. You will also act as an
 **executive advisor** 
 to the team. 
 





  
 





**Your future responsibilities** 








 BCBS239 Implementation:
 




* Lead the adherence to BCBS239 principles, ensuring data quality, accuracy, and reliability in risk data aggregation and reporting.
* Collaborate with risk management, compliance, and IT teams to develop and implement strategies for BCBS239 compliance.
* Monitor and report on BCBS239 implementation progress, addressing any gaps or issues promptly.
* Data Products Transition: Drive the shift from traditional data management approaches to a data product mindset.
* Define and manage data product roadmaps, ensuring alignment with business goals and regulatory requirements.
* Work closely with product owners, data engineers, and other stakeholders to design, develop, and maintain high-quality data products.
* Data Mesh Architecture Adoption: Lead the design and implementation of a data mesh architecture to decentralize data ownership and improve scalability.
* Define and promote best practices for data mesh, including domain-oriented decentralized data ownership and self-serve data infrastructure.
* Collaborate with domain teams to ensure successful adoption and integration of data mesh principles.
* Stakeholder Engagement: Partner with business leaders, IT, and other stakeholders to understand data needs and drive data management initiatives.
* Communicate data management strategies, progress, and outcomes to senior leadership and key stakeholders.
* Foster a data-driven culture within the organization, promoting the value and importance of effective data management.
* Regulatory and Compliance Oversight: Stay updated with regulatory changes and industry best practices related to data management in financial services.
* Ensure data management practices comply with relevant regulations, including BCBS239, GDPR, and other applicable standards.
* Conduct regular audits and assessments to ensure ongoing compliance and identify areas for improvement.



  
 





**You will have** 





* Ability to foresee trends and changes in required development skills
* Get things done mind-set and ability to execute accordingly
* Solution orientation, driving teams to successful delivery
* Persistency to work with virtual teams
* Excellent communication skills in written and spoken English



  
 





**Location** 
 The role is based in Stockholm or Tricity, Poland. Welcome to a team that will drive the next step change of skills within Nordea to deliver the best mortgage solutions for our customers.
 





  
 





**Who you are** 








 Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the four key values that guide us in being at our best. We imagine that you enjoy learning and are excited about bringing your ideas to the table. 
 







 You are dependable, willing to speak up – even when it’s difficult – and committed to empowering others.
 





  
 





**Your profile and background** 





* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Data Science, or a related field. A Master’s degree is preferred.
* Minimum of 8 years of experience in data management, with a focus on financial services.
* Proven experience in driving BCBS239 compliance and implementing data management strategies in a regulated environment.
* Technical Skills:
* In-depth knowledge of data management frameworks, BCBS239 principles, and regulatory requirements in financial services.
* Strong expertise in data architecture, data products, and data mesh concepts.
* Proficiency in data modelling, data governance, and data quality management tools and methodologies.
* Leadership and Communication:
* Excellent leadership and project management skills, with a track record of successfully leading cross-functional teams.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to engage and influence stakeholders at all levels.
* Strategic thinker with the ability to translate business needs into effective data management solutions



  
 





 If this sounds like you, get in touch!
 





  
 





**More information** 








 For more information about the position, please contact Martin Clough, Martin.clough@nordea.com.  At www.nordea.com, you can read more about us and the benefits you will get when joining the Nordea team.
 





  
 



**Time line and process** 






 Please submit your application no later than 
 

 30/08/2024
 





**.** 
  
 





  
 





 Great people often know great people – please share if you have a friend who could be a perfect match for this job. 
 





  
 





 To all recruitment agencies: please note that we do not accept unsolicited resumes for any of our positions. All contact regarding agency resumes should be directed to Nordea Talent Acquisition which handles everything related to recruitment. 
 





  
 





**Only for candidates in Sweden:** 
 For union information, please contact finansforbundet@nordea.se or SACONordea@nordea.com.
 





  
 



**Only for candidates in Poland:**






 Please include permit for processing personal data in CV as following:
 







  
 







 In accordance with art. 6 (1) a and b. Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 27 April 2016 on the protection of natural persons with regard to the processing of personal data and on the free movement of such data, and repealing Directive 95/46/EC (General Data Protection Regulation) hereinafter ‘GDPR’. I agree to have: my personal data, education and employment history proceeded for the purposes of current and future recruitment processes in Nordea Bank Abp.
 







  
 







 The administrator of your personal data is: Nordea Bank Abp operating in Poland through its Branch, address: Aleja Edwarda Rydza Śmiglego 20, 93-281 Łodź. Your personal data will be processed for the recruitment processes in Nordea Bank Abp. You have a right to access your personal data, right to rectify and right to delete. Disclosing the personal data in the scope specified by the provisions of Polish Labour Code from 26 June 1974 and executive acts are mandatory. Providing personal data is necessary to conduct the recruitment processes. The request for the deletion of your personal data means resignation from further participation in recruitment processes and causes the immediate removal of your application. Detailed information concerning processing of your personal data can be found at:  
 







 https://www.nordea.com/en/doc/nordea-privacy-policy-for-applicants.pdf
 







  
 







 We reserve the right to reply only to selected applications.

title: NetSuite Project Manager
description:
**Job Description**
**What you’ll do**
 As a project manager you will be responsible for managing the delivery of NetSuite’s Professional Services implementations of the on-demand NetSuite application.
   

  

 Guide the successful implementation of non-routine and complex business solutions ensuring high quality and timely delivery within budget to the customer’s satisfaction.
   

  

 The Project Manager is a key player in managing, tracking and communicating the progress of projects, and in ensuring the quality delivery of NetSuite’s Professional Services.
   

  

 You will be responsible for the construction, presentation, and sign offs of key deliverables such as Project Kickoffs, Project Plans, Change Orders, regular Status and Risk reports.
   

  

**Qualifications and Skills needed:**
* A strong background in Project Management, including experience developing work-breakdown structures and project plans, most notably in Microsoft Project.
* An excellent understanding of common industry standard business practices as related to Accounting (Accounts Receivable, Accounts Payable, General Ledger, Invoicing), Sales Force Management (Opportunity, Proposal, Sales Orders, Forecasting, territory management and Quotas), Inventory Management (Purchasing and Fulfillment) as well as support (Cases Management and Territory Management).
* Excellent client management skills and the ability to work with customers to develop and manage an implementation plan.
* PM Methodology certification
* Experience with software in an ASP/SaaS environment is a plus as is any experience with financial accounting, customer management, and sales force automation software


 Career Level - IC3
   

  

**Responsibilities**
**Why work at Oracle**
* Join a global workplace where you can make an impact.


**Overview:**
 We offer competitive salaries and exciting benefits – along with flexible and remote working to suit your lifestyle.
   

  

* Get access to development opportunities that can advance your career, an Employee Assistance Program to support your mental health, and core benefits such as medical, life insurance, and access to retirement planning.
* Be yourself in an inclusive culture where employee resource groups champion our diverse communities.


**What We’ll Offer You**
* A competitive salary with exciting benefits
* Flexible and remote working so you can do your best work
* Learning and development opportunities to advance your career
* An Employee Assistance Program to support your mental health
* Employee resource groups that champion our diverse communities
* Core benefits such as medical, life insurance, and access to retirement planning
* An inclusive culture that celebrates what makes you unique


 If this sounds like you, we hope to meet you!
   

  

**Life at Oracle and Equal Opportunity**
 An Oracle career can span industries, roles, Countries, and cultures, giving you the opportunity to flourish in new roles and innovate, while blending work life in. Oracle has thrived through 40+ years of change by innovating and operating with integrity while delivering for the top companies in almost every industry.
   

  

 In order to nurture the talent that makes this happen, we are committed to an inclusive culture that celebrates and values diverse insights and perspectives, a workforce that inspires thought leadership and innovation.
   

  

 Oracle offers a highly competitive suite of Employee Benefits designed on the principles of parity, consistency, and affordability. The overall package includes certain core elements such as Medical, Life Insurance, access to Retirement Planning, and much more. We also encourage our employees to engage in the culture of giving back to the communities where we live and do business.
   

  

 At Oracle, we believe that innovation starts with diversity and inclusion and to create the future we need talent from various backgrounds, perspectives, and abilities. We ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to successfully participate in the job application, interview process, and in potential roles to perform crucial job functions.
   

  

 That’s why we’re committed to creating a workforce where all individuals can do their best work. It’s when everyone’s voice is heard and valued that we’re inspired to go beyond what’s been done before.
   

  

**About Us**
 As a world leader in cloud solutions, Oracle uses tomorrow’s technology to tackle today’s problems. True innovation starts with diverse perspectives and various abilities and backgrounds.
   

  

 When everyone’s voice is heard, we’re inspired to go beyond what’s been done before. It’s why we’re committed to expanding our inclusive workforce that promotes diverse insights and perspectives.
   

  

 We’ve partnered with industry-leaders in almost every sector—and continue to thrive after 40+ years of change by operating with integrity.
   

  

 Oracle careers open the door to global opportunities where work-life balance flourishes. We offer a highly competitive suite of employee benefits designed on the principles of parity and consistency. We put our people first with flexible medical, life insurance and retirement options. We also encourage employees to give back to their communities through our volunteer programs.
   

  

 We’re committed to including people with disabilities at all stages of the employment process. If you require accessibility assistance or accommodation for a disability at any point, let us know by calling +1 888 404 2494, option one.
   

  

**Disclaimer:**
 Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer\*. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans’ status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Oracle will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records pursuant to applicable law.
   

  

* Which includes being a United States Affirmative Action Employer

title: Customer Success Engineer (Swedish)
description:
* Urval sker löpande


 Arbetsuppgifter
   

  

 Börsnoterade Upsales växer så det knakar och med fokus på tech behöver vi skala vårt team ännu mer. Vi söker dig som vill vara en viktig del av en tillväxtresa och vara med och påverka på riktigt.
   

  

 Upsales är ett snabbväxande techbolag som revolutionerar hur företag arbetar med försäljning. Upsales hjälper företag växa fortare genom att förenkla prospektering, förtydligar säljprocessen och skapa en högre förutsägbarhet i intäkterna och hjälper kunderna att ta bättre vara på merförsäljningsmöjligheter. Upsales levererar en helhetslösning för sälj och marknadsteamet genom vår produkt och service.
   

  

 Som Customer Success Engineer är du ansvarig att leverera teknisk support för Upsales plattform till kunder, utvecklare och potentiella kunder över hela världen. Huvudsakliga målet för dig är att hjälpa våra kunder att uppnå sina resultat genom att använda Upsales plattform. Jobbet innebär att förstå och lösa tekniska frågor och kunna rekommendera hur de bäst ska arbeta med Upsales för att nå sina mål.
   

  

 Du kommer bland annat att specialiseras inom Business Intelligence och API:er. Du kommer att lära dig hur du bygger komplexa rapporter och arkitekturen bakom dessa, samt hur kunder har byggt skräddarsydda lösningar mot vårt system. Har du tidigare erfarenhet av SQL, Javascript, API:er är det meriterande.
   

  

 För att trivas i denna roll behöver du vara analytiskt lagd och älska att lösa komplexa problem. Du kommer att vara våra kunders affärs- och IT-guru.\*\*
   

  

**Dina Arbetsuppgifter**
* Leverera teknisk rådgivning till våra kunder.
* Samla in nödvändig information för att på bästa sätt lösa frågor och problem kunderna frågar kring.
* Se till att kunderna uppnår sina mål med Upsales.


 Kvalifikationer
   

  

**Vi Söker Dig Som Har**
* Examen inom systemvetenskap/civilingenjör eller motsvarande
* Ett stort intresse av IT, teknik, webb och mjukvara
* Är duktig på att lyssna in och verkligen förstå kundens behov innan du går på lösning, samt drivs av att lösa de utmaningar som dykler upp.
* Utmärkta kunskaper i svenska och engelska


**Upsales Erbjuder**
* Stora utvecklingsmöjligheter i ett etablerat och snabbväxande techbolag
* Konkurrenskraftig lön
* Brett förmånspaket


 Övrigt/ansökan
   

  

 Tjänsten är på heltid, tillsvidare och med placering på vårt kontor i centrala Stockholm. Tillsättning sker så snart som möjligt.
   

  

 Tveka inte att söka rollen och följ med oss på vår resa att skapa en världsledande mjukvara för marknadsföring och försäljning för B2B företag.

title: Senior Python Engineer
description:
**About Us**
 At Anyfin HQ, nestled in the heart of Stockholm, we're on a mission to transform the financial landscape. Since our start in 2017, we’ve been dedicated to empowering individuals by providing smart tools that put financial power back where it belongs – in the hands of the people. Our vision is straightforward yet profound: to enhance the financial health of our users, one step at a time.We’ve already helped countless Swedes, Finns, Norwegians, and Germans save millions by refinancing expensive consumer credits. But our ambitions stretch further. With new tools, products, and innovative methods on the horizon, we're constantly exploring new ways to elevate people's financial well-being. And to reach these ambitious goals, we need passionate minds and hearts. That’s where you come in.
   

  

**What You’ll Be Doing**
 As a Senior Software Engineer at Anyfin, you'll immerse yourself in a dynamic, fast-paced scale-up environment. Our team is diverse, motivated, and committed to creating amazing tech and products. You’ll work with the core backend services team, playing an important role in building something truly monumental. No two days will be the same as you tackle data pipelines, collaborate with the financial backend and credit teams, and ensure we offer the best solutions to our customers by enhancing our payment infrastructure, accounting, financial reporting, and third-party integrations.Your Responsibilities:
   

  

* Take main ownership of our Python services, driving them to new heights and pushing the boundaries of what’s possible.
* Collaborate closely with key stakeholders including Data Scientists, the Finance Team, Product Managers, and Business Analysts.
* Engage in discussions with external parties such as credit bureaus and partner banks.
* Contribute to both Python and JavaScript services, with a primary focus on Python.
* Actively drive our infrastructure and architecture forward.
* Mentor junior engineers and champion Python best practices internally.


**Who You Are**
 You’re driven by a genuine passion for continuous learning and have an insatiable (fancy word but we felt it was nice to include) curiosity for exploring new opportunities. You’re not afraid to shake things up and involve people from various backgrounds to achieve the best outcomes. You are a master at prioritizing and delivering crucial projects within tight timelines, and the thrill of launching to production energizes you as you constantly think about how to elevate things to the next level.Additionally, you:
   

  

* Have extensive experience in Python (at least 5+ years) and a love for working with it.
* Are proficient in server applications and relational databases (we use Postgres, but experience with any is valuable).
* Have substantial experience with cloud technologies, preferably GCP.
* Possess some experience with JavaScript as you’ll be working with it frequently.
* Hold a degree in Computer Science and have experience in the financial sector or accounting and financial data systems (though this isn’t mandatory).
* Bonus points if you have experience in GraphQL and Machine Learning/AI.


**Why Join Us?**
 We promise a journey filled with challenges, growth, and the opportunity to work alongside brilliant colleagues. We’re driven by a mission to transform an industry and enhance financial well-being. With strong backers and a world-class team, the sky’s the limit for what we can achieve together.
   

  

 While we can't offer relocation for this role, we can't wait to meet passionate individuals ready to join us on this exciting mission. If you're ready to be part of something extraordinary and elevate our tech to new heights, we want to hear from you.
   

  

 Ready to embark on this exciting journey? We look forward to receiving your application!We work from the office four days a week because we believe innovation and collaboration thrive when we meet in person. Unfortunately, we cannot offer relocation support for this position.
   

  

 Anyfin is a Swedish fintech on a mission to improve financial well-being and revolutionize debt management. We empower consumers to track all of their credits and loans in one place and reduce the costs of high-interest credits.

title: Account Executive, New Business
description:
*Modular Finance levererar verktyg till aktörer inom finansbranschen med syfte att skapa effektivitet och transparens på kapitalmarknaden. Vi står inför en spännande expansion vidare i Norden och UK, och söker därför fler stjärnor till vårt kund- och säljteam!* 




  





**Om oss** 




 Vi är ett stabilt, snabbväxande och entreprenöriellt SaaS-bolag inom finans med drygt 60 anställda. Det innebär ett högt tempo, mycket ansvar från start och stor frihet att forma sin egen roll och utveckling. Vi motiveras av att leverera bästa service till våra kunder, frihet att ta egna initiativ och att jobba i en miljö där mycket händer!
 



  





**Om tjänsten** 




 Som Account Executive New Business kommer du att arbeta med försäljning primärt mot helt nya kunder, men det ingår även försäljning av nya avtal till befintliga kunder. I den här rollen kommer du dagligen att interagera med VDar, CFO:s och IR-chefer i börsnoterade bolag.
 



  





 Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter:
 



  




* Ansvara för hela säljprocessen - från prospektering och kontakt, till möten, förhandling och att stänga affären
* Etablera starka och långsiktiga relationer med beslutsfattare i börsnoterade bolag
* Driva interna och externa projekt, självständigt och tillsammans med andra



  





**För att lyckas i denna roll behöver du ha:** 



* 3-6 års erfarenhet av en kundnära roll som till exempel Account Executive, Managementkonsult, kundansvarig eller liknande
* Erfarenhet av kvalitativ B2B-försäljning
* Intresse för börsen och näringslivet
* Utmärkta kunskaper i svenska, tal och skrift
* Goda kunskaper i engelska, tal och skrift



  





**Det är meriterande om du:** 



* Tidigare har arbetat i finansbranschen
* Tidigare har arbetat inom SaaS-bolag i en kundnära roll
* Högre utbildning inom ekonomi eller finans
* Talar ett andra nordiskt språk



  





 För att vara framgångsrik i den här rollen behöver du vara börsintresserad och motiverad att jobba med försäljning. Du kommer ha stor frihet att lägga upp dina dagar, så du behöver ha förmåga att arbeta strukturerat och disciplinerat. Du behöver vara en god kommunikatör i både tal och skrift. Vi värdesätter kollegor som är prestigelösa och vill samarbeta för att nå sina egna och bolagets mål.
 



  





**Vad vi erbjuder** 



* En arbetsplats som främjar lärande och kunskapsspridning inom vårt område
* Vi växer snabbt och för rätt person finns goda möjligheter till spännande utveckling inom bolaget
* Stark teamkänsla och gemensamma bolagsaktiviteter såsom månatliga AW:s och större event
* Ett stabilt bolag med konkurrenskraftig lön, tjänstepension, friskvårdsbidrag, sjukförsäkring och vårdförsäkring
* Delägande i Modular Finance efter avslutad provanställning



  





**Anställningsform:** 
 Tillsvidareanställning med inledande provanställning om 6 månader
 



  





**Startdatum:** 
 Så snart som möjligt
 



  





**Placering:** 
 Stockholm. Vi tillämpar en hybridmodell med 8 valfria remotedagar i månaden.
 



  





**Välkommen att ansöka!** 




 Urvalet kommer att ske löpande, så vänta inte med din ansökan. Vid frågor kring tjänsten är du varmt välkommen att kontakta Jenny Borg, Head of Operations, på
 **jenny.borg@modularfinance.se** 
 .
 



  





 Vi kommer att svara på alla ansökningar.

title: Senior Accounting Analyst - Nordics
description:
**Job Summary**
 MathWorks has a hybrid work model that enables staff members to split their time between office and home. The hybrid model provides the advantage of having both in-person time with colleagues and flexible at-home life optimizations. Learn More: https://www.mathworks.com/company/jobs/resources/applying-and-interviewing.html#onboarding.
   

  

 Join the MathWorks Nordics Finance team as a Senior Accounting Analyst! Working with the Senior Manager of Nordics Finance and Operations you will compile and deliver monthly financial results, prepare the annual expense plan and forecasts, and provide support for the statutory audit.
   

  

 You’ll work across the EMEA Finance and Operations team and will be exposed to senior management, as you prepare monthly financial results, analyze key business issues, and identify opportunities to leverage technology and reduce waste. Grow personally and professionally while building a network within the hi-tech industry!
   

  

 MathWorks nurtures growth, appreciates diversity, encourages initiative, values teamwork, shares success, and rewards excellence.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Working with other members of the Finance Team, prepare and deliver timely and accurate financial results, including the preparation of journal entries, supporting documentation and reconciliations
* Identify opportunities to increase the use of technology and reduce waste related to the aggregation, analysis, and reporting of key data and workflows
* Provide accounting support and documentation to assist with the annual audit, the implementation of new accounting standards and the completion of complex transactions
* Participate in the annual financial planning process and develop financial forecasts.
* Assume responsibility for all payroll and supplier processes for Sweden and Finland
* Responsible for the accurate preparation and submission of monthly and quarterly VAT filings for Sweden, Finland, Norway and Denmark as well as OSS filings for the Baltic countries
* Lead and participate in process improvement, waste elimination and system projects.
* Support the office administration role such as facility management, office supplies and travel support.


**Qualifications**
* A bachelor's degree and 6 years of professional work experience (or a master's degree and 3 years of professional work experience, or equivalent experience) is required.


**Additional Qualifications**
* University level accounting degree with proven Swedish statutory accounting experience
* Proven experience with monthly and yearly closing process, accounts payables, reconciliations, payroll, commissions, inter-company transactions, accrual accounting, tax and VAT preparation
* Possess automated general ledger systems experience (experience with Oracle Cloud a plus)
* Exposure to the payroll process.
* Exposure to multi-national and multi-currency accounting and financial reporting
* Expert skills with Excel and other MS Office applications
* Strong organizational skills and the ability to meet deadlines.
* Strong team player, proven ability in working effectively with cross-functional and virtual teams
* Effective communication skills with all levels of personnel
* Excellent English and Swedish language skills required. Finnish language skills a plus.
* Previous audit history a plus

title: Tech Sales Representative Cloud Marketplace platform - Norwegian Speaking
description:
Join Pax8, a
 **Cloud** 
**Technology Unicorn** 
 that is growing exponentially across Europe. Contribute as a
 **Tech Sales Representative** 
 to the unstoppable momentum of Pax8 EMEA by identifying and nurturing new business opportunities, making connections that matter.
   

  

 We’re looking for a
 **Norwegian speaking** 
 individual who is great at building relationships and connecting with people by phone to
 **join our Pax8 rocket ship in Sweden** 
 .
   

  

**It's our mission** 
 to be the
 **world’s favourite marketplace** 
 to buy
 **cloud products** 
 .
   

  

 Our servant leaders put employees first and we are about delivering exceptional employee experience to inspire customer experience.
   

  

 We are Pax8 where our employee experience meets customer experience - come and be "work happy" with us!
   

  

 It's an exciting time to join us as Pax8 EMEA enter the next significant stage of our incredible growth!
   

  

 Get a feel for our progress, culture and how we constantly strive to be better and do better below:
   

  

**Taste Our Values & Culture Here**
 https://www.pax8.com/en-uk/careers/
   

  

**Check Our HR Leaders People Ethos Here**
 https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-IO3JTx-Dlo
   

  

**See Our Progress In Awards**
 https://www.pax8.com/en-uk/news-post/pax8-triumphs-with-three-awards-at-the-comptia-uki-spotlight-awards/
   

  

 https://www.pax8.com/en-uk/news-post/pax8-named-50th-best-mid-sized-company-to-work-for-in-the-uk/
   

  

 John Street CEO of the year 2023
   

  

 Find new and updated links and articles from our
 **Blog** 
 and
 **News** 
 pages.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
 You will be working in a mature Cloud market. We help our partners build revenue and succeed with cloud services.
 **As a Tech Sales Representative** 
**you will introduce our Pax8 Cloud Marketplace Platform with hundreds of cloud products from the industry’s leading vendors to Small Technology Service Providers to enhance their growth, reduce risk and improve efficiencies.**
 There is
 **no shortage of leads** 
 to generate conversations you could have with more than 149,000 different businesses that could access our platform and use the services we provide to grow their technology business.
   

  

**Your Day To Day Role Includes**
* Increase brand awareness and introduce Pax8’s Cloud services via telephone, email and social media to identify new business
* Provide a high-level overview of Pax8 products and services to potential new Channel Partners to the Pax8 program
* Book follow on discussions with Specialist Account Managers on products related to Productivity, Security, Infrastructure and Continuity products from best in class players like Microsoft, AWS, Acronis, Ironscales, Autotask, Adobe
* Utilise Salesforce to develop and manage a consistent pipeline of qualified prospective opportunities


**You’ll be the ideal Cloud Sales Representative for us if you:**
* Are fluent in Norwegian with good Swedish and English language skills, written and spoken
* Are keen to grow your career in Sales, are a fast learner with drive and a passion for technology
* Enjoy connecting and engaging with people by email and telephone with excellent communication skills
* Are proficient with social media (LinkedIn, Twitter, Facebook)
* Have a strong ability to work independently while supporting a team
* Have the energy and drive to achieve volume phone calls daily
* Can maintain high motivation and a great attitude
* Are coachable and willing to learn


 Culturally you’ll be comfortable in, and perhaps come from, a complex, fast growing technology business.
   

  

**Pax8 Stockholm Office Environment**
* Energetic WeWork Office soon to be revamped
* Regular social and community events
* Naturally light offices for wellbeing at work
* Dedicated desks and breakout arrears with laptop dock and monitors
* Starting salary of 27,000 SEK monthly gross with on-target earnings of up to 34,500 SEK


 In order to fulfil this role you should be resident in this country with a valid right to work.
   

  

**We encourage you to apply for a role at Pax8 even if you don’t meet 100% of the bullet points! We believe in cultivating an environment where there are a diversity of perspectives.**
 We review and acknowledge every application using real humans - Our Talent team are based in the UK - Please look out for a response from us to your application in your inbox but check spam too!
   

  

 If you struggle to get “time out” we’re happy to accommodate early/late conversations and interview times or if you have any queries you can ring Victoria Werder the talent partner managing this role on +44 117 457 7913 Recruiter DDI (No Agencies Please)
   

  

**What's in it for you?**
 Pax8 is a learning accelerant. If you are g
 **rowth minded and curious** 
 , there’s plenty of scope for talented individuals to progress quickly in this opportunity or to other internal options (internal mobility in 2023 was 37%) as we grow and expand. We have our very own internal "Elev8" Academy, Pax8 University & Linkedin Learning for personal development plus access to Learning & Development specialist trainers and extensive "born in the cloud" mentors available for your growth. We’ll provide the opportunity, stretch and projects to help you thrive and see exactly what you need to achieve to get to the next level. You might even get to exchange work location one day with your colleagues in the USA, APAC or across Europe but even if you can't travel right now we guarantee you'll still have fun!
   

  

**Why Pax8?**
**Pax8 is the world’s favourite cloud marketplace for IT professionals to buy, sell and manage best-in-class technology solutions.** 
 The global Pax8 Marketplace features 30,000+ resellers (Managed Service Providers), 400,000+ Small to Medium Businesses (SMBs) and 10+ million end users. We are scaling globally (in a responsible way) while remaining dynamic. As a high-energy organisation, it means everyone can make a meaningful impact in the business. Culture is important to us, and at Pax8, it’s business, and it IS personal. We are passionate, creative, and unconventional. We work hard, keep it fun, and expect the best!
   

  

 We Elev8 each other. We Advoc8 for our partners. We Innov8 continuously. We Celebr8 life.
   

  

**#IND-HP**

title: R&D Senior Engineer – HVDC Control & Protection Application Software
description:
**Description**


As a R&D Senior Engineer – HVDC Control & Protection Application Software, you will be part of the Technology & Solutions Development (Business R&D) organization in HVDC, Hitachi Energy, Ludvika, Sweden. At HVDC R&D Control and Protection System Solutions, we work extensively with Real-Time Hardware-In Loop innovation and development. The cutting-edge solutions developed in this team are the building blocks for commercial HVDC projects, enhancing the HVDC Control and Protection System offering by Hitachi Energy.


The HVDC technology has been on the market for the past 60 years and is an enabler for renewable energy integration, supporting future energy transition for a sustainable future. Please find out more about our world-leading technology at www.hitachienergy.com/HVDC.

**Your responsibility**

* Lead development of HVDC Control and Protection applications.
* Develop and implement High-Level Control and Protection schemes in software, that serves as foundational elements for global HVDC projects.
* Engage in electrical system programming and establish testing strategies adhering to industry norms.
* Collaborate on cutting-edge HVDC solutions with an international team.
* Uphold Hitachi Energy’s values by ensuring safety and integrity, demonstrating leadership in your expertise.

**Your background**

* You bring valuable experience in high-level HVDC C&P application software development, Hardware-In Loop development, and real-time simulation for HVDC systems.
* Your knowledge of HVDC technology is a must-have, and experience with the MACH™ system gives you an extra edge.
* You have a genuine technical interest in HVDC grid connection technologies and are eager to drive future developments in this field.
* As an agile team player, you focus on detail and accuracy, working towards shared goals.
* Your strong problem-solving skills ensure you deliver and document high-quality technical solutions.
* Proficiency in English is crucial for you as part of a global business. Your willingness to share knowledge and passion for technology are key to your role.

**What we offer**

* Collective agreement
* Flexible working time
* Health care and wellness allowance
* Fantastic career possibilities within Hitachi Energy both within Sweden and globally
* Mentor to support you throughout onboard phase
* Various trainings and education supporting employee development
* Diversified company with over 70+ nationalities working in Sweden
* Supplementary compensation for parental leave
* Employee Benefit Portal with thousands of discounts and perks
* More benefits could be connected to this specific role

**Additional information**

  

Are you ready for an exciting new challenge? Does the above description sound like you? Welcome to apply no later than 8th of September 2024! Our selection process is continuous, and the position may be closed before the advertisement expires. So, if you are interested – don’t delay, apply today!

  

Recruiting Manager, Aditya Deb, aditya.deb@hitachienergy.com will answer your questions about the position. Union representatives - Sveriges Ingenjörer; Mikael Hjort, +46 107-38 29 86; Ledarna: Frank Hollstedt, +46 107-38 70 43; Unionen: Fredrik Holmgren, +46 107-38 21 85. All other questions can be directed to Talent Acquisition Partner Ingrid Schjelderup ingrid.schjelderup@hitachienergy.com

title: (Senior) R&D Hardware Engineer (m/f/d)
description:
**(Senior) R&D Hardware Engineer (m/f/d)**
==========================================

#### **At ABB, we are dedicated to addressing global challenges. Our core values: care, courage, curiosity, and collaboration - combined with a focus on diversity, inclusion, and equal opportunities - are key drivers in our aim to empower everyone to create sustainable solutions. That's our story. Make it your story.**

### **This position reports to**


R&D Unit Lead

### **Your role and responsibilities**


Are you interested in shaping the future of the electrical motor-starting technology leader, within ABB’s Electrification business area? Would you like to apply all your expertise, drive your ideas in an autonomous, agile, and global environment within a diverse company? Then, join our highly motivated, innovative team as a (senior) R&D engineer for electronics hardware development, and contribute to the foundations of next-generation ABB products and motor starting solutions. You will be part of an agile, dynamic workplace within a cross-functional team embedded in a global network of collaborating teams. Show your high motivation, hands-on attitude and take the initiative to tackle today’s challenges! You will be mainly accountable for: • You design, develop, and implement analog and digital circuits from concept phase to serial production • Your tasks include the PCBA schematic layout creation, technical risks identification, validation, and execution of the new design ideas by simulation and prototype testing. To make the successful handover to production engineering for industrialization, you provide proper technical documentation • You check that all hardware complies to the published product standards and performances • You collaborate closely with product owner, product management, system architects and software developers to breakdown market requirements to product requirements for hardware • You monitor technology developments and product technologies to identify technical drivers for R&D projects, supported by your thorough understanding of key business drivers for ABB’s products and solutions • You participate in internal and external networks to expand your knowledge of your area of expertise • You take responsibility for hardware development activities, as (senior) member, including risk identification, alignment with targets, and close coordination with suppliers and other functions (e.g. product management) • You contribute to discussions of intellectual property and secure patent rights for ABB by driving the IP creation

### **Qualifications for the role**

* M.Sc. or B.Sc degree in Electronic Engineering, Embedded Systems or comparable field
* At least 2 years of experience in development of electronics within embedded systems as a hardware design engineer
* Sound knowledge in designing electronic circuits, circuit diagrams, and working with simulation tools
* Knowledge in EMC compatible design would be considered a plus
* Willingness to travel internationally (<5%)
* Fluency in English (written and spoken) is essential (C1); Swedish language skills (B2) are beneficial but not a prerequisite

### **More about us**


Recruiting Manager Stephan Wildermuth, +49 160 16 118 69, will answer your questions about the position. Union representatives - Sveriges Ingenjörer: Senad Huijc, +46 730 88 30 06; Ledarna: Lenny Larsson, +46 706 32 85 47; Unionen: Johan Lundström, +46 730 77 03 66. All other questions can be directed to Talent Partner Ludvig Ahlqvist, +46 724 64 43 70. We kindly decline direct contact with staffing and recruitment agencies as well as sellers of additional job advertisements. Please note that, to be eligible for employment at ABB, you will need to pass our pre-employment screening steps. This includes a reference check, a drug test, and could also include an extended background check. Please apply latest by the 11th of September, 2024. We value people from different backgrounds. Apply today for your next career step within ABB and visit www.abb.com to learn about the impact of our solutions across the globe. #MyABBStory
company_description: ABB is a leading global technology company that energizes the transformation of society and industry to achieve a more productive, sustainable future.

title: Construction Project Manager for our projects in Luleå.
description:
We are looking for a highly skilled and experienced Construction Project Manager to join our dynamic team for our infrastructure projects in Norrbotten and Västerbotten. As a key player in our organization, you will be responsible for overseeing and managing construction projects from inception to completion, ensuring they are completed on time, within budget, and meet the highest quality standards.
  
The ideal candidate will have a strong background in construction management, excellent leadership skills, and the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams, ensuring construction projects meet and exceed quality standards and regulatory requirements.
  
The right candidate will be joining the Titan Infrastructure team and will be reporting to the Civil and Infrastructure Manager.
  
  

**Responsibilities will include the following:**  

Project Planning and Execution.
  
Developing comprehensive project plans, including timelines, budgets, and resource allocation.
  
Participating in tenders in the North of Sweden, with a possibility to expand in the whole of Sweden.
  
Coordinate and supervise construction activities to ensure they align with project specifications and deadlines.
  
Implement effective project management processes to optimize efficiency and minimize risks.
  
  

Team Leadership.
  
Build a team, plan, and participate in the recruitment process.
  
Lead and motivate project teams, providing guidance and support to ensure successful project delivery.
  
Foster a collaborative and positive work environment to enhance team performance.
  
Conduct regular team meetings to communicate project goals, progress, and expectations.
  
  

Budget and Cost Management.
  
Monitor project budgets and expenses, identifying cost-saving opportunities without compromising safety and quality.
  
Collaborate with finance and procurement teams to manage contracts, negotiations, and vendor relationships.
  
  

Communication and Stakeholder Management.
  
Establish and maintain strong relationships with clients, contractors, and other stakeholders.
  
Provide regular project updates to internal and external stakeholders, addressing any concerns or issues promptly.
  
  

**Qualifications:**  

A degree in Construction Management, Civil Engineering, Industrial engineering, or related field is a strong plus.
  
Proven experience of at least 5+ years as a Construction Project Manager, Civil Engineer, or Commercial Manager, with a successful track record of managing projects from conception to completion.
  
Strong knowledge of construction processes, regulations, and best practices.
  
Strong negotiating skills and a strong understanding of the commercial side of business.
  
Excellent leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills.
  
Proficient in project management software and tools.
  
Excellent written and spoken English, Swedish is an advantage.
  
  

**Benefits:**  

Competitive salary.
  
Professional development opportunities within construction and/or project management.
  
Learning and development opportunities within the industry.
  
Collaborative and supportive work environment.
  
  

How to apply.
  
If you are ready to take on this exciting opportunity and contribute to the success of our construction projects, please submit your resume and a cover letter through our career site: https://career.titankonstruktion.se/jobs/3450634-project-manager-infrastructure-projects.
  
Join us in building a future of excellence! ️

title: Cell Test Engineer
description:
We are looking for a dedicated Cell Test Engineer to join us in our mission to contribute to a greener future. The role is a part of our excellent/bold/passionate Test & Validation team based in Skellefteå. By joining us, you will be a key player and contribute to building one of the first large scale European battery factories.


**About the job**


You would be responsible for execution of product testing according to the needs of the development projects and outgoing QC. Additionally for leading technical workstreams in installation and commissioning in the test expansion projects.



**Key responsibilities include but are not limited to:**


* Execute FAT, installation, commissioning and SAT of equipment and instrumentation including training for test team personnel in accordance to project delivery milestones
* Work in the expansion project and contribute to planning and execution of the project
* Work closely with and progress the project together with Northvolt experts and specialists from technical, R&D, procurement, quality, construction areas
* Plan and execute testing of cells in different phases of development and mass production
* Develop working procedures and structures for the test team
* Drive continuous improvement and development of methodology and technology
* Provide technical expertise, guidance and training to junior staff and technicians
* Execute the develop test methodology and equipment together with Validation and QC team
* Experience from working with new software and driving automation of testing and data evaluation
* Work with Digitalization team to secure traceability, data collection and reporting.

The person we are looking for is driven, caring and structured. You are used to a high paced work environment and got good time management skills. Qualities that we cherish are flexibility, sense of quality, friendliness, motivation to take on new challenges, grit and a sense of humour.



Northvolt is an equal opportunity employer. We're a diverse group of individuals, united by a common mission, who recognise that while our actions as individuals have a role to play in driving Northvolt towards its goals, we always seek to move forward as a team. We offer you an open and welcoming atmosphere where we win as a team – and fail as a team. Northvolt is growing at the speed of light and we are a strong believer in internal career development. For us it’s important to look at your skills and potential, please refrain form including your picture and age with your application to help us with this.


Apply with CV in English or your complete LinkedIn profile.


Full time employment, fixed salary.
  

Planned starting date is asap.


*Please note that candidates considered for employment with NV may be subject to a mandatory background check process.*


*Please note that any applications submitted via email or direct messaging will not be considered.*


Skills & Requirements


**We believe that you have** **:**



Experience with R&D, li-ion battery testing and high voltage testing is highly preferred


* Technical leadership and coordinating skills in a highly flexible and frequent changing environment are a must
* Experience working with different standards and testing for certification for li-ion batteries.
* Exceptionally good negotiation and problem-solving skill
* Experience in installation, commissioning and acceptance testing of equipment
* Excellent English written and oral skills, Swedish is a plus
* Highly organized and result-driven
* Customer focused
* Ability to work under high pressure and tight deadlines, excellent time management
* Ability to work well with others in a team environment, as well as independently
* Ability to work in a high profile and often high-pressured international environment


**Bonus points for:**


* Experience and interest in manufacturing industry
* Fluency in other languages (Japanese, Swedish, Chinese, French)
* Experience from a multi-cultural environment
Great Place to Work


World leading technique


Top specialists as team peers


International environment


Fast paced & entrepreneurial culture


Warrant program


Wellness grant
company_description: Northvolt is a supplier of sustainable, high-quality batteries. The mission is to build the world’s greenest battery, with minimal carbon footprint and the highest ambitions for recycling

title: Customer Success Engineer (Swedish)
description:
Börsnoterade Upsales växer så det knakar och med fokus på tech behöver vi skala vårt team ännu mer. Vi söker dig som vill vara en viktig del av en tillväxtresa och vara med och påverka på riktigt.
  
  

Upsales är ett snabbväxande techbolag som revolutionerar hur företag arbetar med försäljning. Upsales hjälper företag växa fortare genom att förenkla prospektering, förtydligar säljprocessen och skapa en högre förutsägbarhet i intäkterna och hjälper kunderna att ta bättre vara på merförsäljningsmöjligheter. Upsales levererar en helhetslösning för sälj och marknadsteamet genom vår produkt och service.
  
  

Som Customer Success Engineer är du ansvarig att leverera teknisk support för Upsales plattform till kunder, utvecklare och potentiella kunder över hela världen. Huvudsakliga målet för dig är att hjälpa våra kunder att uppnå sina resultat genom att använda Upsales plattform. Jobbet innebär att förstå och lösa tekniska frågor och kunna rekommendera hur de bäst ska arbeta med Upsales för att nå sina mål.
  
  

Du kommer bland annat att specialiseras inom Business Intelligence och API: er. Du kommer att lära dig hur du bygger komplexa rapporter och arkitekturen bakom dessa, samt hur kunder har byggt skräddarsydda lösningar mot vårt system. Har du tidigare erfarenhet av SQL, Javascript, API: er är det meriterande.
  
  

För att trivas i denna roll behöver du vara analytiskt lagd och älska att lösa komplexa problem. Du kommer att vara våra kunders affärs- och IT-guru.\*\*
  
  

**Dina arbetsuppgifter:**  

* Leverera teknisk rådgivning till våra kunder.
* Samla in nödvändig information för att på bästa sätt lösa frågor och problem kunderna frågar kring.
* Se till att kunderna uppnår sina mål med Upsales.


**Vi söker dig som har:**  

-
  
Examen inom systemvetenskap/civilingenjör eller motsvarande
  
  

-
  
Ett stort intresse av IT, teknik, webb och mjukvara
  
  

-
  
Är duktig på att lyssna in och verkligen förstå kundens behov innan du går på lösning, samt drivs av att lösa de utmaningar som dykler upp.
  
  

-
  
Utmärkta kunskaper i svenska och engelska
  
  

**Upsales erbjuder:**  

-
  
Stora utvecklingsmöjligheter i ett etablerat och snabbväxande techbolag
  
  

-
  
Konkurrenskraftig lön
  
  

-
  
Brett förmånspaket
  
  

Övrigt/ansökan
  
  

Tjänsten är på heltid, tillsvidare och med placering på vårt kontor i centrala Stockholm. Tillsättning sker så snart som möjligt.
  
  

Tveka inte att söka rollen och följ med oss på vår resa att skapa en världsledande mjukvara för marknadsföring och försäljning för B2B företag.
  
  

Upsales is a fast growing Swedish tech company active in the Enterprise Software Industry offering a platform for the Marketing and Sales Team. Our vision is to enable measurable sales & marketing greatness in B2B organizations. Our unified Sales & Marketing solution including Marketing Automation, CRM & powerful Business Intelligence in one integrated experience.

title: Full Stack Engineer (Product team)
description:
*Natural Cycles° is a leading women’s health company that developed the world’s first birth control app, used by millions globally. We are a fast growing startup, and we promote an international working environment filled with smart and ambitious colleagues based in Stockholm, Geneva, New York, and remotely. Our mission is to pioneer women’s health through research and passion, empowering every woman with the knowledge she needs to take charge of her health.* 




  





 We’re looking for a Fullstack Engineer (Product team) who thrives in a fast-paced, data-driven, agile environment and is inspired to use their talents to help us in our mission. Grounded in science and founded by scientists, we pride ourselves with being a very data-driven company and team. This role is thus of great importance and has a high impact cross functionally at Natural Cycles.
 



  





 We are looking for you whose soft skills shine and who can communicate with ease in English. You are passionate about technology, team work, but also have a responsibility and autonomy in your work. You are able to work efficiently in a remote work environment, in a setting where online and asynchronous communication is the foundation.
 



  





 We are a remote-first company and have physical offices in Stockholm, Geneva and New York, which you are welcome to use if you are located nearby. Once or twice per year we all meet up in person in a beautiful location to enjoy a few days together.
 



  





 The position is based in Sweden.
 



  





 As a member of the Product team you will collaborate closely with other engineers, designers, product owners, and testers. Your main responsibility when joining Natural Cycles will be to maintain and further develop our Chatbot and other functionality in the Customer Care domain, which aims to assist and automate our customer service processes.
 



  





**Our Technology stack includes:** 



* TypeScript, Node.js, Express.js running on GCP
* Angular, React, Vue, Ionic, and Capacitor on the Frontends
* Python and Kotlin for Data science
* Highly automated CI pipelines (Github Actions)
* Multiple backend production deployments per day with <2% rollbacks (measured since 2019)
* Backend unit test coverage above 70% since 2019



 We ♥ Open Source, encourage Open Source contributions and often open our
 **general-purpose repositories** 
 .
 



  





**What you will be doing** 



* Implement new and maintain existing functionality of our Chatbot in close collaboration with a team of engineers, designers, data scientists, customer care agents, and QAs.
* Continue integrating Customer Care features into our main product.
* Help our Customer Care team to progress on automation and testing new tools for helping our users.
* Work hands-on with data insights and analytics and if possible, always take the data driven approach.
* Work closely with stakeholders across the organisation to make sure that you provide for the company’s short- and long-term goals and prioritize accordingly.



**What skills and experience we think you have** 



* Experience in Backend and Frontend development alike.
* At least 2 years of experience with modern JavaScript, TypeScript, Node.js in production.
* Experience with continuous delivery and automated testing.
* Good planning and organisational skills.
* Creative and pragmatic approach to problem solving with the ability to focus on details while maintaining the “big picture” view.
* Great communication skills with stakeholders, as well as working closely with the full R&D team with product owners, engineers, designers, and QA.



**Not required but would be a bonus if you also have** 



* Familiarity with public cloud such as GCP.
* Interest in Machine Learning and language models.
* Commercial acumen and understanding of business drivers.
* A passion for women’s health.



  





**What we offer** 



* Flexible work arrangement - you will be part of a team based in and around Stockholm that values effective collaboration and transparent communication, irrespective of work location
* Professional development - you will collaborate with industry leading developers, promoting continuous growth and skill enhancement
* Modern technology - you will leverage innovative technologies and tools, within an environment that empowers you to contribute ideas and take ownership of your work
* Impactful projects - you will contribute to groundbreaking projects that redefine industry standards and create tangible value
* Commitment to quality - you will join a dynamic and progressive organization that prioritizes profitable, long-term product development



  





  





**Location** 




 We are remote-friendly, but we find great value in being able to connect with our teams in person. Most of the product development team you will work with is located in Stockholm.
 



  





  





**Sounds interesting?** 




 If you want to be part of a successful team, we encourage you to apply for this position as soon as possible.
 



 We look forward to hearing from you!
 



  





  





**How to apply** 




 To apply, just upload your CV and answer the questions on the application form. Keep in mind that we can't accept applications through email because of GDPR, and only applications submitted via the career site (and in English) will be considered.
 



  





 At Natural Cycles we value diversity and inclusion because we know that teams with people from different backgrounds and experiences are stronger. We welcome candidates from all walks of life and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees and candidates.

title: Senior Backend Developer
description:

A location in Bergen, Norway may also be considered. Viz One is a centralized and scalable platform to ingest, manage, edit, and deliver content effortlessly and cost-effectively, used by large broadcast organizations all over the world.
 



 As a member of the team developing the core platform, you will be working on enabling the users to search effectively, enrich content with different types of metadata, transfer and transcode media to make sure it is always available in the right place and the right format, and ensure stable interfaces to a large number of internal and third-party integrations.

title: Business Intelligence Developer
description:
*Make our business more intelligent and help people find a new home even faster!* 




  





**Are you a skilled BI developer with a passion for transforming data into insights? Join Sweden's biggest property portal to design data solutions that drive business decisions. Thrive in a dynamic environment and play a crucial role with your analytical and visualization skills. Exciting opportunities awaits! 💚** 




  





 As Sweden's most popular real estate portal, Hemnet receives more than 40 million visits from home-loving people every month looking for their new home. We are a data-heavy company that strives to make even more data-informed decisions every day.
 



  





 As a Business Intelligence Developer, you will be a part of our journey to empower the organization to become more data-driven and help us be a trusted advisor to our customers. You will be part of the Analytics team with business intelligence developers, business analysts, and digital analysts. You will be part of our journey of creating a new data infrastructure, and have opportunities to work both with front- and backend business intelligence.
 



  





**What you will do** 




  




* Support and guide business analysts, business developers, and the rest of the organization with their data needs.
* Improve and develop reports and dashboards within Hemnet.
* Improve our self-service to allow an increasing number of colleagues to find answers themselves.
* Together with our platform team design and implement data models in our data warehouse.



  





**Who we are looking for** 




  





 To be successful in this role we believe that you have an educational background with a strong technical focus and a few years of experience working with business intelligence or analytics engineering. With a deep technical understanding of business intelligence, you support the organization in reaching better insights about our business.
 



  




* Extensive experience (min 3 years) and interest in data visualization and dashboard design in Tableau or similar.
* Very comfortable working with data and SQL. Experience with DBT is a plus.
* Data modeling for analytics needs.
* Scripting knowledge in Python is not a must but helpful 😊
* Ability to work effectively with multiple stakeholders.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English and Swedish.



  





**What we offer** 




  





 Our office is located in the heart of Stockholm, where we meet weekly, with the flexibility to work from home as well. To promote teamwork and spontaneous meetings with our stakeholders, our team is usually at the office 3-4 days a week.
 



  





 Enjoy 30 days of holiday plus 4 extra leave days (YOLO days), paid workouts, running classes/races, and flexible working hours. We provide comprehensive benefits to ensure you feel safe and supported, including pension benefits, parental leave top-up, and health insurance. Here’s our full
 **benefit package** 
 👈.
 



  





 Our culture of sharing includes lab weeks twice a year, Friday demos, dev brekkies, and brown bags. Hemnet is a place where you can be yourself and have fun with others. We actively encourage you to explore and share your other passions – whether it's producing music, painting, or playing with clay.
 



  





 Join us in crafting digital products that make a real impact!

title: Senior Sales Engineer
description:
**Company Description** 




  





 At MicroStrategy, our mission is to make every enterprise a more intelligent enterprise. MicroStrategy transforms organizations into intelligent enterprises through data-driven innovation. We match smart people to dynamic projects and technologies that truly challenge their talents. Curious and creative in outlook, our success is built on the talent and energy of smart and driven people. MicroStrategy (Nasdaq: MSTR) is a worldwide leader in enterprise analytics and mobility software. A pioneer in the AI and BI and analytics space, MicroStrategy delivers innovative software that empowers people to make better decisions and transform the way they do business. We provide our enterprise customers with world-class software and expert services so they can deploy unique intelligence applications.
 



  





 As a global organization, MicroStrategy seeks to provide exceptional career opportunities for people with diverse backgrounds and experiences. We recognize that having a diverse workforce enables us to leverage the strengths and qualities that are unique to everyone. We believe that having a culture of inclusion encourages innovation and that this in turn drives agility and value for our employees, partners, and customers.
 



  





 Values: Bold – Be courageous and Innovative; Agile – Act thoughtfully, move quickly. Engaged – Show up passionately committed. Impactful – Focus on the outcome. United – Work together to win.
 



  





**Job Description** 




  





**The Role:** 




  





 MicroStrategy’s Sales Engineers (Pre-sales Consultants) have a key role in the European Region. As Pre-sales experts, our Sales Engineers are accomplished at dealing directly with clients, along with international colleagues, to help secure results for a global, market leading listed company (NASDAQ: MSTR). Our Sales Engineers work closely with our Sales and Customer Success Management organizations to provide technical solutions for our prospective and existing customers, as well as with our Product and Consulting organizations to provide customer feedback and project handover. They are responsible for designing solutions that will address and resolve a customer's business issues, while evoking confidence in our technology platform and removing all technical objections in the sales cycle.
 



  





 Our Sales Engineers work in tandem with our Account Executives to understand the customers’ goals and challenges to effectively position the value of the MicroStrategy platform. They will manage the technical aspects of the pre-sales engagement, customize demonstrations and respond to technical objections, RFIs and RFP all based on the goal to prove MicroStrategy can meet customers’ decision criteria.
 



  





 Our Sales Engineers are one of the most interactive groups within the customer engagement lifecycle and help to drive pipelines by supporting marketing events, content, MicroStrategy days, etc. The successful candidate will have a consultative sales approach, and value the importance of teamwork. This position is critical to the success of our Sales organization in describing and showing how we provide cost-effective solutions that deliver business value to our customers.
 



  





 You will work with our Regional Partner Managers to understand and grow the enablement level of MicroStrategy’s Partners, as well as make sure that the key MicroStrategy Partners are supported in building their business with MicroStrategy.
 



  





**Your Focus** 




  




* Understand a customer’s goals and challenges through successful discovery to effectively position the MicroStrategy platform in a way that differentiates us from the competition and brings clarity to where we can add value in a customer’s architecture
* Scope, build, and present custom demos and presentations that address key business value for our prospects
* Take technical ownership of the sales opportunity, responding to objections and can manage most aspects of the sales cycle with little assistance
* Handle multiple customer engagements simultaneously
* Research, scope, and respond to customer RFIs and RFPs and take initiative in sharing results with all team members
* Supports Partners and engage with Partners of MicroStrategy to identify and define joint opportunities. The individual will provide functional and technical advice, sales training and other in-person support to Partners on an as-needed basis
* Advance the product knowledge of MicroStrategy partners through education, training, skills transfer, and best practices
* Stay up to date with our demo content and product positioning and be an early adopter of incorporating these changes into our product positioning
* Confidently present and articulate the business value of the MicroStrategy platform at all levels of the customer’s organization
* With a natural passion for new technology, our Sales Engineers are innovative, and create new solutions with out-of-the-box thinking
* Support pipeline generation with marketing events, content, onsite MicroStrategy days, etc.
* Constantly learn and develop expertise in MicroStrategy software through product training classes and unsupervised work assignments. Uses this experience and knowledge to develop expertise in MicroStrategy software including new releases



  





**Required Experience and Skills** 




  




* Strong experience in a comparable Sales Engineer (Pre-sales) position, supporting sales cycles selling Business Intelligence or other high-value business solutions (3-5 Years)
* Experience with BI tools (e.g., MicroStrategy, Tableau, PowerBI, Qlik, SAP Analytics Cloud, Quicksight, Business Objects, Cognos, Looker)
* General knowledge of AI and prompt engineering
* General knowledge of the BI and analytics market
* Specific experience with MicroStrategy a major plus
* Experience with data modeling, data warehousing, data engineering, data integration
* Proficient with SQL
* Understanding of relational databases (e.g., Snowflake, Google Big Query, Databricks, Redshift, Synapse), data warehousing, ETL, web services, SaaS technologies, etc.
* SaaS and Cloud based selling with the main Hyperscalers (AWS, GCP, Azure)
* Ability to present a complete Data + Analytics Architecture to a technical customer representative
* Training in value-based selling (MEDDICC, Force Management, Demo to Win, etc.)
* Demonstrated sales success
* Strong verbal and written communication skills with a focus on requirement gathering, positioning, and business value identification
* Ability to work as part of a cross-functional team
* Superior presentation and demonstration skills
* Self-starter, flexible, and self-motivated
* Highly driven individual with an execution focus, and a strong sense of urgency
* Interested in new technology and staying on top of market trends
* Enjoys the competition and winning new business
* English and Swedish language skills are essential



  





**Desired Experience and Skills** 




  




* Knowledge of other Analytics tools (e.g., Dataiku, DataRobot, Alteryx, Informatica, Talend)
* Experience with Python scripting
* Experience in Data Quality MDM (e.g., Informatica, Talend, Ab Initio, SSIS, Dell Boomi)
* Experience accessing multiple data sources in an enterprise environment (e.g., ERP SAP, Salesforce, Marketo, Google Analytics, Infor, Hadoop or Big Data)
* Knowledge of REST APIs
* Degree educated or equivalent (Computer Science or Information Technology)



  





**Additional Information** 




 MicroStrategy is an Equal Employment and Affirmative Action employer F/M/Disability/Vet/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, creed, color, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, veteran status, sex age, genetic information, or any other legally protected basis.
